project.name: backbone-arch-demo
project.description: An example of a preferred Backbone.js architecture

BaseView.name: BaseView
BaseView.description:
framework/BaseView

This is a view base class built on top of the default Backbone.View; it
provides a set of rendering, binding, and lifecycle methods that tend to
be useful in Backbone applications. As part lifecycle methods, it provides
the facility to maintain a set of child views, especially to avoid zombies.

This view has been further extended to specialize the render method.
To use this view, you should call the 'extend' method of the appropriate
sub-class just like you would extend the normal 'Backbone.View'.
BaseView.author: Bob Holt

ExceptionUtil.name: ExceptionUtil
ExceptionUtil.description:
framework/ExceptionUtil
This is an Exception Utility intended to be used within the framework
for alerting implementors about errors such as bad arguments passed to
framework methods.

It includes a general FrameworkException constructor. This could be extended
if necessary to present more specific exceptions if necessary.
ExceptionUtil.author: Bob Holt

MessageBus.name: MessageBus
MessageBus.description:
framework/MessageBus

Provides the ability to publish and subscribe to messages.
MessageBus.author: Bob Holt

Router.name: Router
Router.description:
framework/Router

Extends Backbone.Router to route to different pages in the application.
Router.author: Bob Holt

Router.name: Router
Router.description: Defining the application router, you can attach sub routers here.

classitems.description:
If you would like to store references to certain elements in your template for later use, you can indicate those elements by doing *both* of the following: - adding a classname beginning with `js-` to the elements in your template - listing the classname suffix in your view's `elements` array For example, if your template contains the following: `
` And your view's `elements` array is: `[ 'interesting' ]` Then your view will have a property `interestingElement` that references a jQuery object for the div.
classitems.name: elements

classitems.description: Set a default template that should be overridden by each implementation
classitems.name: template

classitems.description: Override the constructor to add per-instance configuration
classitems.name: constructor

classitems.description: Adds a View to the list of child views.
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: childSpec
params.description: A map of child view specifications

params.name: id
params.description: A unique id for this child

params.name: viewClass
params.description: The view for this child

params.name: parentElement
params.description: The HTML element to append the view to

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass directly into the Backbone View constructor

classitems.description: Adds an array of child views to the list of child views
classitems.name: addChildren

params.name: childSpecs
params.description: An array of childSpecs to iteratively pass into addChild

classitems.description: Destroys the view and all its children recursively, unbinding their events
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Destroys the specified child of this view, unbinding its events
classitems.name: destroyChild

params.name: id
params.description: The unique name of the child view to destroy

classitems.description: Destroys all the children of this view recursively, unbinding their events
classitems.name: destroyChildren

classitems.description: Retrieves the view's template from the template cache, or creates it if not cached
classitems.name: getTemplate

return.description: template function that accepts a data context

classitems.description:
Once the view has been rendered, it still needs to be placed in the
document. The `place` method allows you to specify a destination for
the view; this destination can either be a jQuery object, a DOM node, or
a selector. The `place` method also optionally takes a position
argument, which determines how the object will be placed in the
destination node: as the first, last, or only child.
classitems.name: place

params.name: node
params.description: The DOM element in which to place this view's element

params.name: position
params.description: Identifier of where in the node to place the view's element

classitems.description:
`postPlace` fires just before the view's `place` method returns. Do
things here that require the view to be placed in the document, such as
operations that require knowing the dimensions of the view.
classitems.name: postPlace

classitems.description:
`postRender` fires just before the view's `render` method returns. Do
things here that require the view's basic markup to be in place, but
that do NOT require the view to be placed in the document
classitems.name: postRender

classitems.description:
Renders the view's element in the DOM
This method expects the derived class to supply a template.name and a template.source
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
The `_setupElements` method is a "private" method for storing references
to elements as indicated by the view's `elements` property.
classitems.name: _setupElements

classitems.author: Naresh Bhatia

classitems.description: Binds callbacks to events on an object
classitems.name: on
classitems.deprecationMessage: `listenTo` and `stopListening` should be used instead of `on` and `off`

params.name: events
params.description: A space-delimited list of events to listen to

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to invoke when the event(s) is fired

params.name: context
params.description: The context in which to invoke the callback

classitems.description: Unbinds callbacks from events on an object
classitems.name: off
classitems.deprecationMessage: `listenTo` and `stopListening` should be used instead of `on` and `off`

params.name: events
params.description: A space-delimited list of events to remove from the object

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to remove from the event/object combination

params.name: context
params.description: The context from which to remove the callback

classitems.description: Trigger callbacks on a particular event
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: event
params.description: The event to trigger

classitems.description: Binds a callback using `on`, which is removed the first time it is triggered
classitems.name: once
classitems.deprecationMessage: It is preferable to use `listenTo` and manually stop listening as part of the callback

params.name: event
params.description: The event to attach to the object

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to fire when the event is triggered

params.name: context
params.description: The context in which to fire the callback

classitems.description:
listenTo needs to be implemented by the View
This allows the View to unbind automatically when it is removed
MessageBus.listenTo would not provide this and should not be used

stopListening needs to be implemented by the View
This removes the events from listenTo.
That is not implemented on the global MessageBus, so neither is this.
Route map
classitems.name: routes

classitems.description:
Directs the application to go to a specific page
Loads the page's view module, renders, and places it
classitems.name: goToPage

params.name: page
params.description: The page name to navigate to
